ratings.question_text: Your level of engagement with the course was:
What is your overall assessment of this course?
The course was well organized to facilitate student learning.
I received clear feedback that improved my learning.
Relative to other courses you have taken at Yale, the level of intellectual challenge of this course was:
Relative to other courses you have taken at Yale, the workload of this course was:

narratives.question_text: What knowledge, skills, and insights did you develop by taking this course?
comments:
An appreciation of Hollywood movies and context.
Analyze the content, history and color of Hollywood from different angles.
Ability to write and analyze Hollywood films.
After taking this course, I view films in a different way than I used to, and I feel much more confident in my movie analysis skills.

I learned about Hollywood throughout the decades and film history as well. We discussed early cinema, the silent era, the American dream and its connection to Hollywood, as well as the direction that Hollywood and film/tv are currently moving towards. I feel like my knowledge of film greatly increased overall.

narratives.question_text: What are the strengths and weaknesses of this course and how could it be improved?
comments: Great class. It would fun to watch more films inside of class time.

A strength of the course was the film and text selections and the meaningful class discussions. I think that some class time could have been used to do other activities, etc. other than just a discussion.

narratives.question_text: Would you recommend this course to another student? Please explain.
comments: Yes, Mr. Swagato's teaching style is very attractive. He guided the students to express their ideas in each class. In this class, we could hear various knowledge and wonderful content about Hollywood.
Yes, great and fun course. Great for summer session.
Yes, I thought that the course was very interesting and it opened my eyes to aspects of movies and Hollywood that I had never thought about before.
Yes! If you're interested in film at all, a course about the development of Hollywood is a great place to start.

narratives.question_text: The Canvas course site allowed me to identify and access required course materials easily.

extras.title: AMST S321 01/FILM S180 01 - Hollywd Novel & Hollywd Movie
